title: Solomon Perel, Jew Who Posed as a Hitler Youth to Survive, Dies at 97
description: His masquerade — a tale recounted in a memoir and in the film “Europa Europa” — saved his life. But “to this day,” he said, “I have a tangle of two souls in one body.”

title: Hazel McCallion, No-Nonsense Canadian Mayor for 36 Years, Dies at 101
description: Tough, pragmatic and brusque when she had to be, she helped transform Mississauga from a sleepy Toronto suburb into one of the country’s largest and most dynamic cities.

title: Master Hsing Yun, Monk Who Spread Buddhism in China, Dies at 95
description: He established a modern brand of Buddhism in Taiwan and opened temples around the world, becoming the rare religious figure backed by Beijing.

title: Corruption Trial of Mexican Ex-Lawman Ripples Beyond Courtroom
description: As prosecutors close their case against Genaro Garciá Luna, the eventual verdict will be felt by Mexican officials and among U.S. agents who work there.

title: AKA, Influential South African Rapper, Is Fatally Shot
description: The rapper, whose legal name was Kiernan Forbes, was one of the most formidable songwriters in South African hip-hop. He and another man were killed outside a restaurant on Friday.

title: Recovery Efforts Go Into Full Swing in Turkey’s Earthquake Zone
description: As the death toll in Turkey and Syria neared 25,000, daunting challenges loomed to care for hundreds of thousands of homeless people amid the wreckage.

title: Valentine’s Day
description: In honor of the holiday, let’s look at the language of love.

title: Repeat Election in Berlin Speaks to the ‘Chaos’ Many Residents Feel
description: The do-over vote on Sunday is only the tip of the iceberg for a city some see as in crisis: short on housing, schools and efficient governance.

title: Can Money Buy Love? Romance Scammers Want You to Believe It.
description: As fraudsters sharpen their hustles, the money lost to romance scams has more than doubled during the pandemic, costing Canadians millions of dollars.

title: Russia Launches Wave of Attack Drones on Ukrainian Infrastructure
description: The overnight strikes with Iranian-made drones capped a day in which Russian forces unleashed a major barrage of missiles on critical sites around Ukraine.

title: Anger Over Quake Response Challenges Erdogan Ahead of Election
description: A furor is building among some survivors over the government’s handling of the crisis. “I have been voting for this government for 20 years, and I’m telling everyone about my anger,” said one. “I will never forgive them.”

title: Wagner Founder Has Putin’s Support, but the Kremlin’s Side-Eye
description: Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, the once secretive tycoon, is confounding Moscow’s Kremlin-allied elite by starting to dabble in politics alongside waging war in Ukraine.

title: Toronto Mayor John Tory Resigns, Admitting to Relationship With Employee
description: The mayor, John Tory, who had led the city since 2014, apologized for what he called a serious error in judgment.

title: Russia Fires Major Missile Barrage at Ukraine as Combat Intensifies
description: The first major aerial bombardment in weeks targeted cities across Ukraine, as President Volodymyr Zelensky returned home from a trip across Europe to press for more arms.
